intro: Quamoclit pallescens, commonly known as the pale quamoclit, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, pale green to yellowish leaves. Its flowers are inconspicuous, consisting of numerous tiny florets arranged in a disc-like cluster. Quamoclit pallescens is often noted for its ability to thrive in wet environments and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
